title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: guide provides step--step workflow identifying Dominant Transcripts (MDTs) within bulk RNA-sequencing dataset. MDTToolset package designed work outputs generated various RNA-Seq quantification tools, including, limited , Salmon Kallisto. accurate detection MDTs, users must utilize normalized data values (e.g., TPM values) bulk RNA-seq data.

title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
code: library(MDTToolset)

title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: section, utilize TPM outputs Kallisto tool, originating (RNA-Seq experiment) [https://www.nature.com/articles/s41597-020-0541-4]. data openly accessible available download. MDTToolset includes two conditions example cases users. already quantification data prepared condition, may proceed next step. Ensure first two column names ‘ENST’ ‘ENSG’, respectively, followed sample names shown . TPM Matrix TPM Matrix
code: ## read TPM data  cond1 <- MDTToolset::cond1 # molecular retina cond2 <- MDTToolset::cond2 # peripheral retina   # visalize the dataframes. Note that you should have knitr R package installed. knitr::kable(head(cond1,2), caption = 'TPM Matrix') knitr::kable(head(cond2,2), caption = 'TPM Matrix')

what: Prepare Files to Remove the Redundant Transcripts
title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: step optional highly recommended. challenge transcript quantification presence redundant transcripts, transcripts identical sequences yield TPM values. redundancy can obscure identification Dominant Transcripts (MDTs) preventing detection singular, dominant transcript given gene. address issue, initial step involves eliminating redundant transcripts dataset. process includes assigning TPM values single representative transcript per redundant group, based comparison protein sequences. Priority given transcripts classified MANE (Matched Annotation NCBI EMBL-EBI) Ensembl database, designating primary transcript. cases MANE transcript identified, transcript randomly selected represent group. step particularly crucial working tools like Kallisto, may assign identical TPM values redundant transcripts. Following , calculation MDTs proceeds using reassigned TPM values. able detect redundat transcripts, need sequences transcripts. Fasta sequence transcripts (cdna sequences) can downloaded designated databases (e.g Ensembl)[https://www.ensembl.org/info/data/ftp/index.html]. provide Ensembl version 104 example. addition, provide Ensembl MANE Select Data (v104) help remove redundant transcripts found Kallisto output files. download version MANE select, navigate Ensembl website version used, proceed BioMart website, select fields Gene Stable ID, Transcript Stable ID, RefSeq Match Transcript (MANE Select), download TSV file. Please note user employ version used quantify transcript abundances ensure consistency. function prepare_Seq() takes fasta MANE file input gives dataframe showing ENSG (Gene), ENST (Transcript), ENSP (Protein), MANE ID, ENST Sequence. merge transcript TPM expression matrix file ensg_enst_seq file prepared previous step second column includes ENSG ids. TPM Matrix TPM Matrix transcripts sequences might different peptide lengths, aim select ones longest sequence redundancy. information accessed directly via Ensembl Biomart, need download transcripts’ peptide sequences calculate length peptides. provide Ensembl version 104 example. case want prepare different version, download ENSG, ENST, peptide sequences Biomart use following function MDTToolset: df_biomart_seq_length <- MDTToolset::MDTToolset::prepare_seq_length(‘mart_export.txt’) file ‘mart_export.txt’ fasta file format: >ENSG0000000XXXX|ENST0000000KKK MQRSPLEKASVVSKLFFSWTRPILRKGYRQRLELSDIYQIPSVDSADNLSEKLEREWDRE LASKKNPKLINALRRCFFWRFMFYGIFLYLGEVTKAVQPLLLGRIIASYDPDNKEERSIA IYLG* >ENSG0000000YYYY|ENST0000000ZZZ MTAEEMKATESGAQSAPLPMEGVDISPKQDEGVLKVIKREGTGTEMPMIGDRVFVHYTGW LLDGTKFDSSLD Transcripts’ Peptide Seq Length
code: # read MANE Select ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 <- MDTToolset::ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 <- ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 %>% dplyr::distinct() # While downloading data from Biomart, the values might not be unique - make sure the rows are unique # prepare sequences and Mane select transcripts dataframe ensg_enst_seq <- prepare_Seq(MDTToolset::Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.cdna.all, ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104)  ## Select transcripts having MANE ids enst_mane_iso <- ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104[!(is.na(ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104$RefSeq.match.transcript..MANE.Select.) | ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104$RefSeq.match.transcript..MANE.Select. == ''),c(1,2,3,4)] cond1_ENST_ENSG <- merge(ensg_enst_seq[,1:2], cond1, by='ENST') cond2_ENST_ENSG <- merge(ensg_enst_seq[,1:2], cond2, by='ENST')  # visalize the dataframes. Note that you should have knitr R package installed. knitr::kable(head(cond1_ENST_ENSG,2), caption = 'TPM Matrix') knitr::kable(head(cond2_ENST_ENSG,2), caption = 'TPM Matrix') # Example dataframe for df_biomart_seq_length  df_biomart_seq_length <- MDTToolset::df_biomart_seq_selection  knitr::kable(head(df_biomart_seq_length,2), caption = "Transcripts' Peptide Seq Length")

title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: remove_redundant() function takes three inputs, transcript TPM file (ENST ENSG columns), ENST sequence file, Mane select file prepared previous step. one transcript gene sequences, one removed, TPM value added selected transcript. Additionally, transcript assigned MANE, transcript prioritized ones. MANE selects redundant transcripts, transcripts longest peptide sequence chosen. output previous TPM file without redundant ones.
code: ## Example Usage #cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant <- remove_redundants(data_matrix = cond1_ENST_ENSG, enst_ensp_sequences = ensg_enst_seq, mane_select =  NULL, peptide_lengths = NULL) cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant <- remove_redundants(cond1_ENST_ENSG, ensg_enst_seq, enst_mane_iso, df_biomart_seq_length) cond2_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant <- remove_redundants(cond2_ENST_ENSG, ensg_enst_seq, enst_mane_iso, df_biomart_seq_length)

title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: next step involves identifying Dominant Transcripts (MDTs) dataset. find_mdts() function calculates MDTs based two criteria: user-defined cutoff min_exp. cutoff parameter specifies enrichment rate expressions first second-ranked transcripts. min_exp determines minimum expression level transcripts must meet considered MDTs.
code: cond1_mdts <- find_mdts(cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant, cutoff = 2, min_exp = 0.2) cond2_mdts <- find_mdts(cond2_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant, cutoff = 2, min_exp = 0.2)

title: Introduction to Most Dominant Transcripts
text: provide basic boxplot plot using ggplot plot number MDTs condition also bar graph visualize number MDTs sample. ### visualize number MDTs condition
code: # Distribution of number of MDTs in each sample MDT_boxplot(cond1_mdts, cond2_mdts, title = "Distribution of Number of MDTs", x_axis_label = "Condition", y_axis_label = "Number of MDT")

title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
code: library(MDTToolset)

title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
text: following files given together MDTToolset. like see prepared, please see tutorial: Introduction Dominant Transcripts.
code: cond1_mdts <- MDTToolset::cond1_mdts cond2_mdts <- MDTToolset::cond2_mdts cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant <- MDTToolset::cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant cond2_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant <- MDTToolset::cond2_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant # read MANE Select ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 <- MDTToolset::ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104 # prepare sequences and Mane select transcripts dataframe ensg_enst_seq <- prepare_Seq(MDTToolset::Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.cdna.all, ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104)  ## Select transcripts having MANE ids enst_mane_iso <- ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104[!(is.na(ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104$RefSeq.match.transcript..MANE.Select.) | ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104$RefSeq.match.transcript..MANE.Select. == ''),c(1,2,3,4)]  # Select the only ENSTs having ENSP Protein IDs. ensp_only <- ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104[!ensg_enst_ensp_mane_v104$Protein.stable.ID == "",]

what: Calculate MDT Switching Events in the Data
title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
text: switch_calculator() function identifies MDT switching events sample comparing “Normal” cohort another specified cohort, thereby defining dMDT (disease-specific MDTs). considers following criteria: cutoff: percentage samples comparison group (cond2 case) may MDT Normal cohort. cutoff 0 stringent ensures dMDT observed samples cond2. cutoff_rate: enrichment rate Transcript 1 Transcript 2 cond1_mdts cond2_mdts datasets. cutoff_other_MDTs: percentage cond2 samples another MDT gene. MDT Switching Events
code: # Calculate switches in condition 1 compared to condition 2 Cond1_Cond2_Switches <- switch_calculator(cancer_ori = cond1_mdts, gtex_ori = cond2_mdts, exp_values_pcawg = cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant, exp_values_gtex = cond2_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant, ensp_sequences = ensg_enst_seq, ensp_only = ensp_only, cutoff = 0, cutoff_rate = 2, cutoff_other_MDTs = 50)  # visalize the results. Note that you should have knitr R package installed. knitr::kable(head(Cond1_Cond2_Switches,5), caption = 'MDT Switching Events')

previous_headings: Load MDTToolset > Calculate Functional Impact of Transcript Switches by Integrating the Transcript Interaction Network
title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
text: Different transcripts gene can varying exons, leading changes protein domains. changes may disrupt interactions protein interaction partners. understand functional impact switching events, incorporate transcript interaction network switching results. MDTToolset provides Isoform Network, IsoNetwork_v12, based STRING v12. network following columns. ENSG: Ensembl gene ID ENSP: Ensembl protein ID ENST: Ensembl transcript ID STRINGensp: STRING protein ID, considered canonical STRINGintN: Number proteins STRINGensp interacts STRING database ExistIntN: Number interactions ENST involved MissIntN: Number interactions ENST lost RelMissIntN: Percentage interaction loss ExistInts: Existing interactions ENST MissInts: Lost interactions ENST Isoform Interaction Network
code: IsoNetwork_v12 <- MDTToolset::IsoNetwork_v12_subsetData knitr::kable(head(IsoNetwork_v12,5), caption = 'Isoform Interaction Network') # read where the Pfam ENSG_ENST_ENSP_Pfam <- MDTToolset::ENSG_ENST_ENSP_Pfam

previous_headings: Load MDTToolset > Calculate Functional Impact of Transcript Switches by Integrating the Transcript Interaction Network
title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
text: understand interaction partners ENSTs (lost kept) expressed sample, implemented function buildIsoNet() takes four inputs: dMDT_network_info: Merged database: switching results Isoform Network ensembl_data: ENSG_ENST_ENSP_Pfam kallisto_counts: cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant iso_network: IsoNetwork_v12 Interaction Lost dMDTs
code: # we first merge the switching results with Isoform Network dMDTs_IsoNetwork <- merge(Cond1_Cond2_Switches, IsoNetwork_v12, by.x='dMDT', by.y='ENST') dMDTs_IsoNetwork_int <- dMDTs_IsoNetwork[dMDTs_IsoNetwork$MissInts != '-' | dMDTs_IsoNetwork$ExistInts != '-',]  Switching_Events_Network <- buildIsoNet(dMDT_network_info = dMDTs_IsoNetwork_int, ensembl_data = ENSG_ENST_ENSP_Pfam, kallisto_counts = cond1_ENST_ENSG_nonredundant, iso_network = IsoNetwork_v12) knitr::kable(head(Switching_Events_Network,2), caption = 'Interaction Lost of dMDTs')

title: MDT Switching Event and Its Functional Impact
text: visualize_network() function take two inputs: ENSP id, Isoform Network, IsoNetwork_v12. gives graph showing network protein (transript interest) using igraph R package.

title: Detection of Most Dominant Transcripts (MDTs), MDT Switches and their Functional Impacts
text: R package MDTToolset designed calculate Dominant Transcript switches RNA-Seq datasets. enables users : Remove redundant transcripts identical protein sequences aggregate transcript counts. Calculate dominant transcripts RNA-Seq data using flexible cutoffs, user-defined transcript expression enrichment cutoffs. Identify MDTs present user-defined percentage samples. Calculate MDT Switching events flexible user-defined cutoffs. Integrate isoform interaction network MDT switches understand functional impact protein interaction network. Visualize expression MDTs disease-specific MDTs (dMDTs). Visualize network dMDTs.

title: Detection of Most Dominant Transcripts (MDTs), MDT Switches and their Functional Impacts
text: Alternative splicing plays essential role development, tissue specificity essential cell functions. One gene can encode many transcripts, one transcripts might expressed significantly higher level transcripts. transcripts defined dominant transcripts (MDTs). cancer, canonical MDTs might switched transcripts call MDT switching event. MDTToolset aims find MDTs RNA-seq data evaluated MDT switching event flexible user-defined way. user can define cutoffs transcript expression, MDT enrichment.
